messages.subject: Files available for download

executor_description: Creates a new share object for the given path in your account. We support three types of shares:  A shared folder allows you to let outside parties access a folder in your account (including any files and nested subfolders) using just a link. Shared folders can be restricted; e.g. with an expiration date, password, download-only, etc. Shared folders are 'live'; if someone makes a change to a file in your shared folder, it will be immediately reflected in your account, and vice-versa. A file send lets you send one or more files via an easy download link. File sends are different than shared folders because file sends are 'point in time' -- the recipient will get the files as you sent them. If you later make a change to the source file, it will not be updated for the recipient. You'll also need to use the POST /shares/complete-send/{id} endpoint to generate invitation emails for your new send. A receive folder lets you receive files into your account. You can either send users a link, or optionally embed a customized form on your website.

queryParams.description: Enum: "file" "folder" "shared_folder" "send_receipt" "share_receipt" "file_drop" Example: type=file Type of notification include in the list. Valid options are file, folder, send_receipt, share_receipt, file_drop  If this parameter is not used, only file and folder type notifications are included in the list.
Default: 0 Example: offset=50 Starting notification record in the result set. Can be used for pagination.

Example: sort=date What order the list of matches should be in. Valid sort fields are resourcename, date, action and type. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending.  You can chose multiple options for the sort by separating them with commmas, such as "type,-date" to sort by type, then most recent.
Default: 25 Example: limit=100 Number of notification records to return. Can be used for pagination.
Enum: "resource" "share" "user" Example: include=resource,share,user Related records to include in the response. Valid options are ownerUser, resource, share

Enum: "connect" "download" "upload" "delete" "all" Example: action=all The kind of action which triggers the notification. Valid choices are connect (only for delivery receipts), download, upload, delete, or all  Note The all action matches notifications set to "all", not all notifications. For example, notifications set to trigger only on delete are not included if you filter for action=all

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

messages.subject: Message subject.
messages.body: You have files available for download.

executor_description: Get a list of shares that you would have access to view through the web interface. You can limit which results are returned by specifying specific types of shares you wish to view, finding things shared with a specific email address, as well as finding shares for specific folder names.

queryParams.description: Example: offset=100 Current offset of records (for pagination)
Default: 100 Example: limit=10 Limit of records to be returned (for pagination)
Enum: "all" "active" "currentUser" Example: scope=active Set of shares to return. (all=all of them, active=shares that are currently active, curentUser=shares created by you)
Enum: "created" "-created" Example: sort=created What order the list of matches should be in. Sort values are; sort_shares_name, created, sort_shares_user, and sort_shares_access_mode.
Enum: "receive" "shared_folder" "send" Example: type=receive Limit the list of matches to only certain types of shares.
Example: include=owner,notifications Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Possible values are owner, resources, notifications, activity.

Example: name=Customer* When provided, only shares whose names include this value will be in the list. Supports wildcards, such as send* to return everything starting with "send".  Use this parameter if you are searching for shares or receives for a specific folder name. For example /Clients/ACME/To Be Processed.

Example: recipient=test@example.com Filter the results to include only shares that invited a certain email address. Supports wildcard matching so that *@example.com will give back entries shared with addresses ending in "@example.com".

Example: message=submitted When provided, only shares with a message that contains the text will be included in the list of matches. Both the subject and the body of all messages will be checked for matches. This will always be a wildcard match, so that searching for taxes will return any shares with a message that contains the word "taxes".
Example: username=example When provided, only shares created by the user with that username will be included in the list. Does not support wildcard searching.
Searches the share name, username, recipients, share messages fields for the provided value. Supports wildcard searches.

executor_description: Returns a list of files and folders in the account. Use the resource query parameter to indicate the folder you wish to search in (which can be /).

queryParams.description: Resource identifier to get resources for. Can be path/id/name.

Example: sort=name Endpoint support multiple sort fields by allowing array of sort params. Sort fields should be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Sort values are; name, size, date, type, and timeline.

Default: 0 Determines which item to start on for pagination. Use zero (0) to start at the beginning of the list. e.g, setting offset=200 would trigger the server to skip the first 200 matching entries when returning the results.
The number of files to limit the result. If you have more files in your directory than this limit, make multiple calls, incrementing the offset parameter, above.
Limit types of resources returned to "file" or "dir" only. This is ignored if you are using the name parameter to trigger a search.

Text to match resource names. This allows you to filter the results returned. For example, to locate only zip archive files, you can enter *zip and only resources ending in "zip" will be included in the list of results.
Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Possible values are share, notifications, directFile, parentResource, ownerUser, ownerAccount.

Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Updates the settings for the user. Note that the unique key for this API call is our internal ID, and not the username, as the username can be changed.  In the request body, you should only send the parameters for values that you wish to change for the user.

pathParams.description: Example: 2224 The user's ID. Note that this is our internal ID, and not the username. You can obtain it by calling the GET /users method.

Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

pathParams.description: Example: 2224 The user's ID. Note that this is our internal ID, and not the username. You can obtain it by calling the GET /users method.

queryParams.description: Example: include=homeResource,owneraccount Comma-separated list of relationships to include in response. Possible values include homeResource and ownerAccount.

executor_description: Delete a user from the account. Deleting a user does NOT delete any files from the account; it merely removes a user's access. Aternatively, locking a user via the PATCH /users/{id} will keep the user in your account, but make it unable to log in.  Resources and shares owned by the deleted user will be owned by the master user after the deletion.

pathParams.description: Example: 2224 The user's ID. Note that this is our internal ID, and not the username. You can obtain it by calling the GET /users method.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Get a list of the users in your account. There are three main types of searches you can do with this method:  Search for a user by username. If you provide the username parameter in your call, then only the user who exactly matches that username will be in the list of matches. Any other parameters are ignored. Search for a user by individual filter fields (nickname,email,role,status,homeDir). Users in the list will be ones who match all of the filters you choose to search by. For example, you could look for users with the "admin" role AND email addresses ending in "*@acme.com". Search for a user by search string. If you provide the search parameter, users whose nickname OR email OR role OR homeDir match value your provide.

queryParams.description: Example: username=testuser The username of the user you are looking for. Only entries with the same username as this will be in the list of results. Does not support wildcard searches.
Resource identifier for user's home directory. Does not support wildcard searches.
Nickname to search for. Ignored if username is provided. Supports wildcard searches.
Example: email=*@example.co Email to search for. Ignored if username is provided. Supports wildcard searches
Example: role=use Types of users to include the list. Ignored if username is provided. Valid options are admin, master and user
Whether a user is locked. Ignored if username is provided. 0 means user is locked, 1 means user is not locked.
Searches the nickname, email, role and homeDir fields for the provided value. Ignored if username is provided. Supports wildcard searches.
Example: offset=50 Starting user record in the result set. Can be used for pagination.

Example: sort=homeDir,-modified Sort order or matching users. You can sort by multiple columns by separating sort options with a comma; the sort will be applied in the order specified. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending.  Valid sort fields are: nickname, username, email, homeDir and modified
Example: limit=100 Number of users to return. Can be used for pagination.
Example: include=homeResource,ownerAccount Comma separated list of relationships to include in response. Valid options are homeResource and ownerAccount.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

Value: "share" Related record types to include in the response. Valid option is share

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_display_name: Get form data entries for a receive
executor_description: Returns the form data entries for a specific form for a receive. Optional parameters can be included in the call to manage larger data sets.

pathParams.description: ID of the form to retrieve entries for.

queryParams.description: Example: limit=10 Limit of records to be returned (for pagination)
Example: offset=100 Current offset of records (for pagination)

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_display_name: Get receive folder form by Id
executor_description: Returns the file upload form assigned to a receive folder. The form details will return all the input fields and their settings.

pathParams.description: Form unique ID number.

queryParams.description: Example: include=share Enter "share" to get information about associated receive folder.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_display_name: Updates a form with given parameters
executor_description: Add, update, or delete a form's parameters. This will alter how your users/customers will see and interact with the form when sending you files.

pathParams.description: Form unique ID number.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Returns the webhook logs for your account. Use the available query parameters to filter the listing of activity that is returned.

queryParams.description: Earliest date of entries to include in list
Latest date of entries to include in list
Webhook listener endpoint
Example: event=resources.upload Type of activity that triggered the webhook attempt
Example: statusCode=200 Response code from the webhook endpoint
Example: resourcePath=/folder* Path of the resource that triggered the webhook attempt
Example: username=exampleuser Filter by triggering username.
Example: offset=100 Records to skip before returning results.
Example: limit=10 Limit of the records list

string Example: sort=-date,event Comma separated list sort params. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Sort options are; endpoint_url, event, status, username, attempt_id, and resource_path

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Returns the detailed activity logs for your account. Optional query paramaters will filter the returned results based on a number of options including usernames, activity types, or date ranges.

queryParams.description: Example: startDate=2019-10-18T06:48:40Z Start date of the filter data range
Example: endDate=2019-10-18T06:48:40Z End date of the filter data range
Example: ipAddress=127.0.0.1 Used to filter session logs by ip address.
Example: username=jdoe Username used for filtering a list
Path used to filter records. Wildcard matches require an extra * at the start of the parameter such as */Orders* to find all things in the /Orders path.
Example: type=EDIT_SHARE Filter session logs for operation type (see table above for acceptable values)
Example: offset=100 Offset of the records list
Example: limit=10 Limit of the records list

Example: sort=-date Comma separated list sort params. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending. Sort options are; date, ip_address, username, file, sort_logs_file_source, type, duration, size, and protocol

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Get the details for a notification with a specific ID number. You'll be able to review its path, triggers and who's getting the notification.

pathParams.description: Example: 3 ID of the notification. Use GET /notifications if you need to lookup an ID.

queryParams.description: Example: include=resource,share Related record types to include in the response. You can include multiple types by separating them with commas. Valid options are ownerUser, resource, and share.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Create a new notification for a resource in your account. Notifications can be sent via email or webhook;  To enable email, pass an array of email addresses to the recipients parameter of this call. To enable webhooks, setup the webhook callback URL in your account settings via PATCH /account.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Deletes a notification. Note that deleting a notification only deletes the notification – it does not delete any underlying files or folders.

pathParams.description: Example: 3 ID of the notification. Use GET /notifications if you need to lookup an ID.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_description: Get a list of all the notifications you have access to. You can use sorting and filtering to limit the returned list.

queryParams.description: Enum: "file" "folder" "shared_folder" "send_receipt" "share_receipt" "file_drop" Example: type=file Type of notification include in the list. Valid options are file, folder, send_receipt, share_receipt, file_drop  If this parameter is not used, only file and folder type notifications are included in the list.
Default: 0 Example: offset=50 Starting notification record in the result set. Can be used for pagination.

Example: sort=date What order the list of matches should be in. Valid sort fields are resourcename, date, action and type. The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus (“-“), in which case it will be descending.  You can chose multiple options for the sort by separating them with commmas, such as "type,-date" to sort by type, then most recent.
Default: 25 Example: limit=100 Number of notification records to return. Can be used for pagination.
Enum: "resource" "share" "user" Example: include=resource,share,user Related records to include in the response. Valid options are ownerUser, resource, share

Enum: "connect" "download" "upload" "delete" "all" Example: action=all The kind of action which triggers the notification. Valid choices are connect (only for delivery receipts), download, upload, delete, or all  Note The all action matches notifications set to "all", not all notifications. For example, notifications set to trigger only on delete are not included if you filter for action=all

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

attributes.name: /Test
attributes.readableDescription: anybody uploads to, downloads from or deletes from '/Test'
attributes.readableDescriptionWithoutPath: anybody uploads to or downloads from this folder

executor_description: Update an existing notification. You can add additional emails or change the action or users that cause a notification to trigger.  When updating recipient emails, make sure your recipients parameter contains the full list of people who should be included on the notification. If you resend the list without an existing recipient, they will be deleted from the notification emails.

executor_description: Resend invitations to one or all recipients attached to specified share. The most recent message that was sent for the share will be re-used for this email.

pathParams.description: ID of the share to resend invites for.

headers.description: API Key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

executor_display_name: Resend welcome email to specific user
executor_description: Send a welcome email to a user. The contents of the welcome email can be set by PATCH /accounts.

pathParams.description: Example: exampleuser A username to send the welcome email to.

headers.description: API key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

value.emailContent: Greetings, ExampleUser!  Your account is ready for you to start transferring files right now. Here's your link to set up your account [[setpassword]]  Henceforth, you shall be known as [[username]]
value.customSignature: Please consider the planet before printing this email

executor_display_name: Send referral email to a given address
executor_description: Invite a friend to sign up for a free trial of ExaVault. Send a referral email to an email address. If the recipient signs up for ExaVault, we'll apply a credit to your account for the referral.

headers.description: API key required to make the API call.
Example: 5dc97cc607985eb8da033220e7447647e7915fbf73808 Access token required to make the API call.

value.message: I use ExaVault for secure file sending, and so should you. Follow my link to sign up for a trial.
